title: Nightly compiler panics when attempting to mutate a shared reference.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust fn does_work() -> Vec { // Does work and returns a new Vector vec![1, 2, 3] } struct TestClient { inner: Vec, } impl TestClient { fn transform(&mut self) { self.inner.extend(does_work()); } fn get_inner_ref(&self) -> &Vec { &self.inner } } fn main() { let mut client = TestClient { inner: vec![] }; client.transform(); let mut inner = client.get_inner_ref(); inner.clear(); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.58.0-nightly (65c55bf93 2021-11-23) binary: rustc commit-hash: 65c55bf931a55e6b1e5ed14ad8623814a7386424 commit-date: 2021-11-23 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.58.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` In case it helps, when using the stable toolchain, the compiler does not panic but instead emits this error: ``` $ cargo build Compiling bug_test v0.1.0 (/home/projects/bug_test) warning: variable does not need to be mutable --> src/main.rs:24:9 | 24 | let mut inner = c.get_inner_ref(); | ----^^^^^ | | | help: remove this `mut` | = note: `#[warn(unused_mut)]` on by default error[E0596]: cannot borrow `*inner` as mutable, as it is behind a `&` reference --> src/main.rs:25:5 | 24 | let mut inner = c.get_inner_ref(); | --------- help: consider changing this to be a mutable reference: `&mut Vec` 25 | inner.clear(); | ^^^^^ `inner` is a `&` reference, so the data it refers to cannot be borrowed as mutable For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0596`. warning: `bug_test` (bin "bug_test") generated 1 warning error: could not compile `bug_test` due to previous error; 1 warning emitted ``` `Stable version used in above output:` ```rustc 1.56.1 (59eed8a2a 2021-11-01) binary: rustc commit-hash: 59eed8a2aac0230a8b53e89d4e99d55912ba6b35 commit-date: 2021-11-01 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.56.1 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling bug_test v0.1.0 (/home/projects/bug_test) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 5 but the index is 5', compiler/rustc_borrowck/src/diagnostics/mutability_errors.rs:450:53 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.58.0-nightly (65c55bf93 2021-11-23) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `main` #1 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/65c55bf931a55e6b1e5ed14ad8623814a7386424/library/std/src/panicking.rs:498:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/65c55bf931a55e6b1e5ed14ad8623814a7386424/library/core/src/panicking.rs:107:14 2: core::panicking::panic_bounds_check at /rustc/65c55bf931a55e6b1e5ed14ad8623814a7386424/library/core/src/panicking.rs:75:5 3: >::map::::report_mutability_error::{closure#2}> 4: ::report_mutability_error 5: ::access_place 6: ::visit_statement_before_primary_effect 7: ::visit_results_in_block::, rustc_index::bit_set::BitSet, rustc_index::bit_set::BitSet>, rustc_borrowck::dataflow::BorrowckAnalyses, rustc_mir_dataflow::framework::engine::Results, rustc_mir_dataflow::framework::engine::Results>, rustc_borrowck::MirBorrowckCtxt> 8: rustc_borrowck::do_mir_borrowck 9: ::enter:: 10: rustc_borrowck::mir_borrowck 11: >::call_once 12: >::with_task:: 13: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(&rustc_middle::mir::query::BorrowCheckResult, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job::{closure#3}> 14: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 15: ::mir_borrowck 16: ::time::<(), rustc_interface::passes::analysis::{closure#2}> 17: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 18: >::with_task::> 19: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job>::{closure#3}> 20: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::>> 21: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 22: ::enter::> 23: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> 24: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 25: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}> 26: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. ```
